sections.1_story_intuition: Indian Geography covers the physical, political, and economic features of India. It includes mountains, rivers, climate, states, and resources. For competitive exams, mastering Indian Geography helps in scoring well in the GK section as questions are direct and fact-based.
2_key_definitions: Geography: Study of Earth's physical features, climate, and human activity.
Peninsula: Land surrounded by water on three sides.
Delta: Landform at the mouth of a river formed by sediment deposits.
Monsoon: Seasonal wind bringing heavy rainfall.
Tributary: A river or stream flowing into a larger river.
Union Territory: Region governed directly by the Central Government.
Biosphere Reserve: Protected area for conservation of biodiversity.
Longitude/Latitude: Imaginary lines for locating places on Earth.
3_key_facts_data_points: India is the 7th largest country by area.
Northernmost point: Indira Col, Southernmost: Indira Point.
Major mountain ranges: Himalayas, Western & Eastern Ghats.
Tropic of Cancer passes through 8 states.
Major rivers: Ganga, Yamuna, Brahmaputra, Godavari, Krishna, Narmada, Kaveri.
Major crops: Rice, wheat, sugarcane, cotton.
Major ports: Mumbai, Chennai, Kolkata, Kochi.
Major biosphere reserves: Nilgiri, Sundarbans, Gulf of Mannar.
Neighboring countries: Pakistan, China, Nepal, Bhutan, Bangladesh, Myanmar, Sri Lanka.
4_micro_notes: Indira Point is in Andaman & Nicobar Islands.
Rajasthan is the largest state by area.
5_exam_capsules: Which is the largest state by area? Rajasthan.
Which is the smallest state? Goa.
Which is the highest peak? Kangchenjunga.
Which is the longest river? Ganga.
Which is the largest delta? Sundarbans.
Which state has the longest coastline? Gujarat.
Which is the wettest place? Mawsynram.
Which is the largest lake? Vembanad.
Which river forms the Sunderbans delta? Ganga-Brahmaputra.
Which is the largest desert? Thar Desert.
Which is the southernmost point? Indira Point.
Which is the northernmost point? Indira Col.
Which is the largest island? Middle Andaman.
Which is the major port on the west coast? Mumbai.
Which is the major port on the east coast? Chennai.
7_traps_confusing_points: Confusing Indira Point (south) with Indira Col (north).
Mixing up largest and longest rivers.
Assuming all Union Territories are on the mainland.
Confusing Kangchenjunga with Mount Everest (Everest is not in India).
Mixing up the number of states and UTs.
Assuming all deltas are in West Bengal.
Confusing Tropic of Cancer with Equator.
Mixing up capitals of northeastern states.
Assuming all biosphere reserves are in the south.
Confusing Thar Desert with Rann of Kutch.

8_case_study_context.title: The Sundarbans Delta
8_case_study_context.explanation: The Sundarbans, formed by the Ganga and Brahmaputra rivers, is the world's largest delta and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is famous for its mangrove forests and Royal Bengal Tigers, and is crucial for flood control and biodiversity.
